page.title: 01Beeley Moor
page.content: This is an upland area, over 300 metres above sea level, of mainly moorland and heath but with some farmland. A large proportion is in the {Peak District National Park}including an area of Chatsworth Estate Farming includes enclosed rough grazing and intensively managed grassland. The population consists mainly of a few farming communities living in the original stone farmhouses. The area is served by secondary roads, is supplied with electricity, but has no other amenities. The major interests in the area are ecology and farming. Ecology includes a description of landscape, plantations, conservation, animals, birds and flowers from the moorland, Hipper valley and South East farming area. Farming includes animals, crops, machinery, buildings. Home life and local history are mentioned.
